title: Tuna Pasta Salad W/ Peas
summary: Tuna Pasta Salad W/ Peas might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 6. Watching your figure? This dairy free and pescatarian recipe has 343 calories, 15g of protein, and 8g of fat per serving. For 73 cents per serving, this recipe covers 16% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 10 minutes. A few people made this recipe, and 19 would say it hit the spot. A mixture of onion, ground pepper, mayonnaise, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Tuna Pasta Salad with Peas, Peas and Pasta Salad with Tuna, and Tuna Pasta Salad with Dill & Peas.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
